inference: Solution: The area of the equilateral triangle is $\frac{\sqrt{3}}{4}(12^2)=36\sqrt{3}$ square centimeters. The area of the circle is $\pi(6^2)=36\pi$ square centimeters. The area of one of the small shaded regions is $\frac{1}{6}$ of the area of the circle, or $6\pi$ square centimeters. The sum of the areas of the two small shaded regions is $12\pi$ square centimeters. The area of the triangle minus the area of the two shaded regions is $36\sqrt{3}-12\pi$ square centimeters.  The area of the triangle minus the area of the two shaded regions is equal to the area of the larger shaded region.  The area of the larger shaded region is $36\sqrt{3}-12\pi$ square centimeters.  The sum of the areas of the three shaded regions is $36\sqrt{3}-12\pi+12\pi=36\sqrt{3}$ square centimeters.  Therefore, $a+b+c=36+1+3=\boxed{40}$. I hope it is correct.
